page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT IN FELTWELL
page.content: Feltwell people work in a wide variety of trades. In the village and the immediate surrounding area people work on farms, in shops, on the base and in a small engineering works. A larger engineering works closed down in 1983. Many ladies work on farms doing seasonal work hoeing, cutting and packing vegetables. Many workers travel out of the village to work in Thetford in factories on the industrial estates. Many others work as support staff at the U.S.A.F. bases at Lakenheath and Mildenhall. Some are employed by the Forestry commission in Breckland and others use Feltwell as a base for commercial travelling. Unemployment in the area is lower than in most parts of Britain but there is a greater number of retired people.
